articles.author: Scott Matherson
articles.description:
The Dogecoin price has weakened recently following a particularly bearish month of August that sent the crypto market spiralling. In the wake of this, multiple cryptocurrencies in the market have begun to move toward finding support in anticipation of a possible recovery. Dogecoin is no different, but unlike a lot of others, the move toward support is signaling a rapid recovery for the DOGE price that could see it double from here.
 
Dogecoin And The Falling Wedge Pattern
 
With the decline in price, the Dogecoin price has formed a falling wedge pattern, as outlined by a crypto analyst Simon on TradingView. Now, as the meme coin continues to follow this falling wedge pattern, it holds a number of implications for the price. One of these is a possible price breakout depending on how well it…
articles.title: Crypto Analyst Says Dogecoin Price Will Jump 100% If This Important Level Holds

articles.author: Arnab Shome
articles.description:
The Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has taken an interest in the restructuring plan of the now-collapsed FTX and revealed its intentions to challenge the crypto exchange’s payment plan to its creditors if they were paid in stablecoins.
“The SEC is not opining on the legality, under the federal securities laws, of the transactions outlined in the Plan and reserves its rights to challenge transactions involving crypto assets,” a motion filed by the SEC last Friday noted.
FTX’s Redistribution Plan
The regulator’s motion came after the collapsed crypto exchange floated a redistribution plan for its debtors.
FTX filed for bankruptcy in November 2022 with an $8 billion deficit. Although the exchange's condition looked grim when it filed for Chapter 11 protection, the bankruptcy administ…
articles.title: SEC Might 'Challenge' FTX If Creditors Are Paid in Stablecoins

articles.description: Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong announced the platform’s first AI-to-AI cryptocurrency transaction, highlighting a new application of digital currency by artificial intelligence agents. Armstrong believes this advancement will enhance AI’s capacity to independently obtain resources and engage with humans and other AI systems. He encourages developers to add crypto wallets to support the growth of AI-to-AI […]
articles.title: Coinbase Reports Its First AI-to-AI Crypto Transaction

articles.author: Bitcoin.com
articles.description: Rhodium Encore LLC, a bankrupt bitcoin mining company, has received court approval for a unique debtor-in-possession financing plan that allows borrowing in either U.S. dollars or bitcoin. Galaxy Digital Holdings Ltd., a blockchain firm led by Mike Novogratz, has offered to provide Rhodium with a loan of either $30 million in dollars or 500 bitcoin. […]
articles.title: Court Approves BTC Loan for Bankrupt Bitcoin Mining Firm

articles.author: Jamie Redman
articles.description: Frax Finance has launched the Frax Name Service (FNS), a decentralized identity service that allows users to register unique names on the Frax blockchain. Frax Finance Expands Ecosystem With Launch of Frax Name Service Frax Finance has introduced the Frax Name Service (FNS), a decentralized identity service designed specifically for the Frax ecosystem. FNS is […]
articles.title: Frax Finance Launches Frax Name Service for Decentralized Identity Management

articles.author: Margaux Nijkerk
articles.description: The highly anticipated upgrade markes the ecosystem's long-planned shift towards decentralized governance.
articles.title: Cardano’s Chang Hard Fork Goes Live, Introducing On-Chain Governance

articles.author: Sergio Goschenko
articles.description: The Brazilian Supreme Court ordered a nationwide ban on X after a prior order mandating the social platform to assign a local representative was ignored. Brazilians began to lose access to the site on Saturday, as the Supreme Court prohibited citizens from using virtual private network (VPN) software to circumvent the blockage, establishing fines of […]
articles.title: Brazilian Supreme Court Bans X, Imposes Fines for VPN Circumvention

articles.author: Jamie Redman
articles.description: With just 65 days remaining until the U.S. presidential election, bitcoin wrapped up August with an 8.6% decline compared to where it started the month. Historically, in the last two election cycles, bitcoin’s value has only shown substantial appreciation after the election had ended and a victor was declared. From 2012 to 2020: How Bitcoin […]
articles.title: US Election-Year Bull Runs: How Bitcoin Historically Surged Post-Victory

articles.author: Jamie Redman
articles.description: The blockchain-powered prediction market Polymarket saw an additional $85.84 million in trading volume during August, marking a notable uptick from July. August’s volume of $472.87 million set a new high, surpassing every month since Polymarket’s inception. Polymarket Volume Soars in August While some sectors faltered in August, Polymarket thrived, setting new records with $472.87 million […]
articles.title: Polymarket Hits Record $472.87M in August Volume Amid Election Betting Frenzy
